zxcv.index module

zxcv.plot module

zxcv.process module

zxcv.process.cor_xr(da1, da2, dims='time')

Calculate correlation coefficient matrix between da1 and da2

Parameters

  • da1 (xarray.DataArray) – 1-D (time) DataArray

  • da2 (xarray.DataArray) – 3-D (time, lat, lon) DataArray

  • dims (str) – The axis that you want to calculate, defaults to “time”

Returns

2-D (lat, lon) DataArray, correlation coefficient matrix.

Return type

xarray.DataArray

zxcv.process.cov_xr(da1, da2, dims='time')

Calculate covariance matrix between da1 and da2.

Parameters

  • da1 (xarray.DataArray) – 1-D (time) DataArray

  • da2 (xarray.DataArray) – 3-D (time, lat, lon) DataArray

  • dims (str) – The axis that you want to calculate, defaults to “time”

Returns

2-D (lat, lon) DataArray, covariance matrix.

Return type

xarray.DataArray

zxcv.process.t_cri(N, sig_level=95.0)

Calculate a t-critical value according to the given significance level [%]

Parameters

  • N (int) – sample size

  • sig_level (float, optional) – significance level, defaults to 95.

Returns

t-critical value

Return type

float

>>> zxcv.process.t_cri(20, 95)
2.1009220402409623
